intro: Uapaca albida, commonly known as the white syringa, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and rocky habitats. Uapaca albida is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
